channel.title: NYT > Science
channel.description: Find breaking news, science news & multimedia on biology, space, the environment, health, NASA, weather, drugs, heart disease, cancer, AIDS, mental health and animals.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2006 The New York Times Company

item.title: In Energy Work, One Hand Giveth and the Other Taketh
item.description: The goals of President Bush and Congress differ in ways that compete for research dollars and are costing some government researchers their jobs.
item.author: MATTHEW L. WALD

item.title: Icy Ball Is Larger Than Pluto. So, Is It a Planet?
item.description: The discovery of 2003 UB313 has intensified a debate over the definition of a planet, which has swirled about Pluto since the late 1990's.
item.author: KENNETH CHANG

item.title: Behind Bush's New Stress on Science, Lobbying by Republican Executives
item.description: Industry officials eager to see a greater government commitment to research held a series of discussions with administration officials late last year.
item.author: JOHN MARKOFF

item.title: Education: More Training Is Seen as Key to Improving Math Levels
item.description: President Bush's proposal to increase the ranks of advanced teachers in math and science does not envision hiring new teachers.
item.author: DIANA JEAN SCHEMO

item.title: How to Listen for the Sound of Plutonium
item.description: Knowing, with precision, when a country is about to gain the ability to build an atomic bomb is a problem Washington has faced for decades.
item.author: DAVID E. SANGER and WILLIAM J. BROAD

item.title: Essay: A Genius Finds Inspiration in the Music of Another
item.description: Albert Einstein was fascinated by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart and sensed an affinity between their creative processes.
item.author: ARTHUR I. MILLER
